messages.message:
:wave-hello-goodbye: I was attempting to remove a user from a commercial org, but the org ran out of available consumption units.

Apparently most functionality is restricted when there are not enough units -- however, I feel like it might be useful to allow users to remove members from an org regardless of having a positive unit balance. :thought_balloon:

There is a comment from @Xindi Xu in the code about this! "Currently, a user who has been in an org can still start a free trial after they leave the org. This is a loophole that we should fix. After the fix, make it true [allow deleting members when out of units]"

Awesome, thank you for the insight!

Follow-up Q:
> Currently, a user who has been in an org can still start a free trial after they leave the org
I imagine in an ideal world we might want to allow this, but I can see a loophole where:
• user A starts org1 via commercial trial inviting user B, C, D, ...
• org1 runs out of credits
• user B leaves org1 and starts org2 trial (assuming they haven't started an org trial before -- or does this matter?) and invites A, C, D... to org2
• Org1 members have exploited the trial process and now have another "free" 14 days of commercial
Am I thinking through the scenario correctly? :thought_balloon:
